botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Hybrid Tea, or Large-flowered bush roses are upright, thorny shrubs with large, usually glossy leaves and large, double often fragrant flowers that may be solitary or in threes

how_to_grow.cultivation: Vigorous upright bush rose can be trained as a short climber; prefers a sheltered position in full sun and moderately fertile, humus-rich, moist but well-drained soil. For best flowering apply a balanced fertiliser and mulch in late winter or early spring and a balanced fertilizer again in early summer. Tolerant of poor soils and a little shade. Suitable for hedging and good for cut flowers. See rose cultivation for further advice.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by hardwood cuttings in autumn or by chip budding in summer
how_to_grow.pests: Aphids, leafhoppers, glasshouse red spider mite, scale insects, caterpillars large rose sawfly and rose leaf-rolling sawfly may be a problem. Also rabbits and deer can cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by black spot, rose rust, powdery mildews, and a downy mildew
